content: simple legwarmers size 8 needles either 12 circular or 4 dpns 180 yards willow wash or other worsted weight yarn a row marker darning needle 2 x 2 rib k2 p2 in the round is so perfect for basic legwarmers it has enough body to stay up slouching only somewhat at the ankle where there is positive ease but it is still a very elastic rib accommodating strong shapely legs unless you are an unusually tight or loose knitter i would probably not bother to make a gauge swatch but plunge right in an size 8 needles with worsted weight yarn there is so much give to the rib that gauge is not super critical if you want to use up all of the whole skein of yarn you have i have a couple of suggestions 1 if you have a kitchen scale weigh the first legwarmer as you knit it and compare it to the weight of the remaining yarn keep working until you have used up half of the yarn by weight reserving enough to bind off about a yard 2 if you buy your yarn at a shop that will wind your yarn ask them to wind it into 2 balls of equal weight or 3 wind your yarn into a center pull ball and work back and forth on the 2 leg warmers one from the center and one from the outside until they look like they are the same length following one of these methods also allows us to avoid counting all the rounds of the legwarmers to make them match directions cast on 52 stitches with the long tail method then join in the round place a row marker first and all row *k2 p2* repeat all around on the first few rounds make sure you do not let the work get twisted inadvertently creating a möbius work until you have 11 or you have used half your yarn with about a yard leftover for the bind off and bind off loosely make the second one the same way i recommend that you make the bind off edge the top of the leg warmers as that tends to flare out a bit more than a cast on does weave in ends with a darning needle
